name: Hotel Oasis

reviews.title: Nice city/ average hotel
reviews.text: I have just returned from a trip to Nice with my partner and feel I must report on this hotel. We paid extra for a "courtyard view", room and found this dull. Reported this and asked for a change but "no chance" was the reply. No-one had complained about our room in the last 3 years!! Stayed 4 nights but could not recommend it. Bathroom smelled damp. Used all lights during the day in a bid to brighten bedroom up. Quite depressing in the afternoon. Part of a tree was cut down by the management in a bid to help but little difference. Wardrobe space very poor. Tea/Coffee facilities in room but policy is not to replenish after 1st day!
I have no idea why anyone would want to give this hotel anything other than glowing comments!
reviews.title: Don't believe the bad reviews

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed for a week in this little gem of a hotel, and loved it. We had a lovely, bright sunny room overlooking the courtyard/garden. The family who run it could not have been more friendly (their young daughter introduced mine to their pet rabbit) and every one of the staff were as helpful as could be. The central location is superb - 5 minutes stroll to the railway station, and a little more to the promenade, with excellent restaurants and bistros nearby.
reviews.title: Truly an oasis
Great hotel! Everything perfect!
reviews.text: All in all a great place to stay for a holiday - we will be back, hopefully soon.

reviews.title: Second stay not as good as first
reviews.text: We had stayed at the hotel 3 years ago and had been quite impressed and although we were aware of the small rooms, this year we were extremely disappointed. We had room 11 on the ground floor which smelt of damp (or something), had marked walls and was in need of decoration and refurbishment although the bathroom was in a reasonable state. As we walked past reception having deposited our luggage, the man behind the desk asked us if we liked our room and before we could answer he said 'because the hotel is full and I cannot change it.' Breakfast is completely self service, including make your own tea/coffee by boiling the kettle. On a positive note, the hotel is quite central for both the station and the beach and is also in a very quiet location. Our standards are high and we felt let down this year. We may well return to Nice but will certainly not stay at The Oasis!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the oasis for only one night but really enjoyed the location, the room and the staff. They offer a nice parking place inside the area. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast didn't offer as much choice as a big hotel, but was completely ok for us. If you want to go to the beach, it takes about 15-20 minutes to go there.
reviews.title: Really a nice and friendly place !

reviews.text: I really can recommend the oasis to everyone !
reviews.title: Very Good Indeed

reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights in June and can recommend it highly. It's a short walk to the beach in one direction and to the railway station in the other. Rooms are small, as advertised, but very clean and the hotel staff are both friendly and helpful. Breakfast outside in the courtyard is very good, the coffee is just grand, and you're not a far walk from loads of bars and restaurants. When I go back to Nice I'll be staying here.
reviews.title: Hardly an Oasis, but comfortable
Oasis of Calm
reviews.text: A delightful hotel! The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is ideally suited for exploring Nice and the surruonding area; the train station is a 5 minute walk away as are some very nice restaurants. the Promenade Anglais and town centre are within easy walking distance too. The room we hadwas clean, comfortable and well equipped. Our room, which overlooked the courtyard was a triple room and afforded plenty of space for 2 people. I would certainly recommend this hotel and will be using it on future trips to Nice.
Nice little hotel in the city centre. L'Oasis is within walking distance of the beaches, the station and the old town. A great place to stay for an introduction to Nice.
reviews.title: Nice little Hotel
Disappointed
reviews.text: Our room was a triple room so had plenty of space for the two of us. In room facilities were good with TV, aircon, safety deposit box & fridge.

description: Located in the centre of Nice on a quiet lane the L'Oasis Hotel offers an ideal base for guests looking to explore. This facade of terracotta, green wooden shutters and some wrought iron balconies adds to the ambiance and tranquility of this hotel. This hotel is only 500m from the popular Promenade Des Anglais and the beach, while the elegant arcade Place Massena, with its sparkling fountain, gardens is a mere 800m walk away.
